channel.title: Project Insanity - Compiler Error In Client
channel.description:
This is my Compiler
[IMG]http://i1155.photobucket.com/albums/p549/JBSician/Error.jpg[/img]
When I compile I get this error
[IMG]http://i1155.photobucket.com/albums/p549/JBSician/Error2.jpg[/img]
I have tried changing many things but can't quite work my way around this little bugger. If you can solve this then please explain to me how to do it.

item.title: Project Insanity - Compiler Error In Client
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“Broham, post:8, topic:447433”][quote author=JBSician link=topic=550329.msg4033555#msg4033555 date=1340994481]
In the Compiler and what would I change the method to. I posted my method so how would I change it.
[/quote]

:p, there is no method in your compiler it’s a batch program. And this error you are getting basically means that the program is trying to execute javac.exe but it can’t find the specified directory.[/quote]
+1
In my defence I didn’t read the OP, just the comments:P.

Read full topic
item.source: Project Insanity - Compiler Error In Client

item.title: Project Insanity - Compiler Error In Client
item.dc:creator: @Wank Broham
item.description:
@Wank wrote:

JBSician:

In the Compiler and what would I change the method to. I posted my method so how would I change it.

:p, there is no method in your compiler it’s a batch program. And this error you are getting basically means that the program is trying to execute javac.exe but it can’t find the specified directory.

Read full topic
item.source: Project Insanity - Compiler Error In Client

item.title: Project Insanity - Compiler Error In Client
item.dc:creator: @JBSician JBSician
item.description:
@JBSician wrote:

I changed the code to

@echo off title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\javac.exe" -d ./Rs2/Class/ ./Rs2/Java/*.java ./Rs2/Java/sign/*.java pause

And now it works.

Read full topic
item.source: Project Insanity - Compiler Error In Client

item.title: Project Insanity - Compiler Error In Client
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

lol^
https://www.google.co.uk/search?aq=1&oq=setting+your+envi&sugexp=chrome,mod=14&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8&q=setting+your+environment+variables+for+java
Basically, it can’t find the path to your Java/jdk and you need to set it up, its pretty simple really. Don’t get confused by the weird wording<3

Read full topic
